fullText: Her title, like many theatrical matriarchs, is awfully hard to live up to, which is also what Mother Play struggles to do.
showScoreExcerpt: "Her script assembles the contradictions...but it doesn’t provide a route through them."

keyPhrases.quote: Her script assembles the contradictions...but it doesn't provide a route through them
but it doesn’t provide a route through them.

llmScore.reasoning: Claude: The excerpt criticizes the script's fundamental structure and execution, suggesting the playwright fails to resolve the material's contradictions, which indicates significant creative problems. | GPT-4o-mini: The review indicates a lack of clarity in the script, suggesting a mixed recommendation without strong enthusiasm.

bwwExcerpt: As Phyllis, Lange has to carry the play, which she manages to do in fits and starts. What she can do is cast a spell. In a wonderful, wordless sequence when Phyllis has been abandoned by both Carl and Martha, she putters around an empty apartment, devoid of purpose but retaining the posture of a woman raised to be watched, finding humor and subtle tragedy in the way she slathers hot sauce on a microwaved dinner.
